quote_last: when Hedworth Westerling, chief of staff in name as well as power now, alighted from the gray automobile that turned in at the Galland drive, the chauffeur thought well enough of himself to forget the crush of supplies and ambulances that had delayed His Excellency’s car for at least ninety seconds in the main street of the town.
title: The Last Shot
author: Frederick Palmer

quote_last: before the door opened, and a drunken-looking groom, ill-kempt and side-whiskered with an inflamed face and disreputable clothes, walked into the room. Accustomed as I was to my friend’s amazing powers in the use of disguises, I had to look three times before I was certain that it was indeed he.
title: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
author: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle

quote_last: the condition of the English army was serious. The Prince of Orange was in command of the centre, Hill of the right wing, Picton of the left wing. The Prince of Orange, desperate and intrepid, shouted to the Hollando-Belgians: “Nassau! Brunswick! Never retreat!”
title: Les Misérables
author: Victor Hugo

quote_last: . He helped Delphine to her feet and led her down a passage to a rear door that gave on to the hospital garden.
title: The Blue Afternoon
author: William Boyd
